title.narrative: Consultative Group to Assist the Poor 2015-18

description.narrative: The Consultative Group to Assist the Poor (CGAP) is the leading independent resource for objective information, expert opinion, and innovative solutions for microfinance. Housed at the World Bank in Washington, it works with the financial industry, governments and investors to effectively expand access to financial services for poor people around the world. It works with stakeholders to set standards and identify best practices, and provides advisory services for governments and financial institutions. Working through a network of worldwide partners, CGAP develops innovative solutions that help microfinance to more effectively serve the needs of poor people. Continued membership of CGAP provides an opportunity for the Australian Government to stay abreast of microfinance best practice to inform future engagement in the area.
